wikipedia_page.main: William of Macclesfield (died 1303–04) was an English Dominican theologian, with the nickname Doctor Inclytus. He was created Cardinal in December 1303 by Pope Benedict XI; it is unclear whether this was before his death.

link_mentions.page: List of philosophers born in the 11th through 14th centuries

response: *William of Macclesfield (1303), probably died before his promotion

Benedict XI also intended to name the English Dominican priest William of Macclesfield as the Cardinal-Priest of Santa Sabina on this date but the cardinal-elect died before news of his elevation could reach him.
